alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 2:01PM EDT until April 12 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN BROWARD AND NORTHERN MIAMI-DADE COUNTIES... At 201 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from the previous thunderstorms. This has lead to some street closers due to water covering the roadways. Another line of showers and thunderstorms over the Atlantic waters will be moving northwest and into the warning area during the next hour capable of producing additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches. These additional rains will continue to cause flooding issues over the warning area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Miami Beach, Surfside, Miami Gardens, Hallandale, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Sunny Isles Beach, Opa-Locka, West Park, Miami Shores, North Bay Village, El Portal, Golden Glades and Ojus. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
